Martin Luther King Jr.’s daughter pushed back on a Republican political candidate’s claim that her father’s legacy inspired him to create a campaign ad blasting critical race theory and praising guns.
The ad begins with a woman saying, “Critical race theory is crap.” Critical race theory is the study of United States history through a lens that includes the impact of slavery and systemic racism.
“Josh: Regretfully, I do not believe that I or @TheKingCenter legitimately motivated you to film this ad, as it is in opposition to nonviolence and to much of what my father taught,” King tweeted.
Mandel’s ad segues to a shot of him standing on Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma, Alabama, which King and other civil rights demonstrators crossed during an historic march in 1965.
In a follow-up tweet, Mandel insisted that MLK Jr. was pro-gun, as evidenced by him applying for, and being denied, a gun permit after his home was bombed.
“Sometimes I engage with individuals who are misusing my father to educate more people (who read the exchanges) on his teachings,” she wrote.
“When I decided that I couldn’t keep a gun, I came face-to-face with the question of death and I dealt with it,” her father wrote.
